intro: Bustillosia chilensis var. setacea, commonly known as the Chilean featherflower, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Chile. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to the temperate and coastal climate of its native habitat.
